articles.author: Hugh Son
articles.title: Regional banks face another hit as regulators force them to raise debt levels - CNBC
articles.description: All American banks with at least $100 billion in assets would be subject to the new requirement.
articles.content:
Martin Gruenberg, acting chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. (FDIC), speaks during an Urban Institute panel discussion in Washington, D.C., on Friday, June 3, 2022.
